articles.title: About Ellena Girma
articles.contents:
R For Plant Breeders
          
          
          About
          Blog
          Workshops
          Resources
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About Ellena Girma
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Github
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Portfolio
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am a data analyst intern at The International Center for Tropical Agriculture(CIAT) in Arusha, Tanzania. In this role, I primarily work on projects that deal with agrobiodiversity for the common bean. I created this blog to have a central place to share what I have learned in this role. I also wanted to create a resource for my colleagues who want to learn how to use R for plant breeding.
            I graduated from La Salle University in Philadelphia in 2021 with a B.S. in Integrated Science Business & Technology (ISBT). Being an ISBT major taught me to view my skillset as a toolbox and use various tools from different fields to solve a problem. As I discovered more skills to add to my toolbox, I found data visualization. I was immediately interested in learning how to visualize and share scientific work in a clear & concise manner. In exploring data viz, I made my way into the broader field of data science and analytics.
            This is a site made with R Markdown, the distill R package, the postcards R package, and deployed to Netlify.
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About Ellena Girma

I also wanted to create a resource for my colleagues who want to learn how to use R for plant breeding.

Being an ISBT major taught me to view my skillset as a toolbox and use various tools from different fields to solve a problem. As I discovered more skills to add to my toolbox, I found data visualization. I was immediately interested in learning how to visualize and share scientific work in a clear & concise manner. articles.title: Resources
articles.description: Here are links to outside resources I've found helpful as I learn how to use R for Plant Breeding & agrobiodiversity.
articles.contents:
Contents
Setting Up R
Downloading R & RStudio
R Studio’s Interface

Using R: Basics
General Resources
Package Specific Resources


Setting Up R
Downloading new software or programs can be an overwhelming task. This page has some resources that can help you get R set up.
Downloading R & RStudio
It is recommended that you use R on RStudio’s environment. So you will need to download both R and RStudio. A great video resource that takes you through the setup is Shashank Kalanithi’s Data Analyst Setup for Productivity (Python, R, SQL). Minutes 22:40 - 25:00 are what you’ll want to watch to set up your R environment.
R Studio’s Interface
R Studio has four windows that help organize your view as you work through your data analysis process. To get familiar with RStudio’s interface, I suggest watching RStudio for the Total Beginner. The tutorial focuses on how to navigate to and use each window.
Using R: Basics
Since most of my blog posts will be about using R for plant breeding specifically, I wanted to share some external resources that you can use to get more familiar with R functions and uses.
General Resources
 RDocumentation  is a great site to search up R packages and functions.
 RStudio Cheatsheets  shares downloadable cheatsheets for many widely used packages that will help you figure out what functions in that package do.
Package Specific Resources
 ggplot2 .
tidyverse.
